PhysX for Virtools


Interfaces to PhysX in Virtools Dev

General Access:

The most functionality is accesible through 3 ways :

  • BuildingBlocks
  • VSL ( See DataRelations )
  • Attributes
  • ParameterOperations

For instance you want to register a simple box in the physic engine you can use :

  • the building block PBPhysicalize
  • VSL : pFactory::createBody()
  • Attributes : Category "Physics" : Attribute "Object"
  • Dragging a NxStream - XML - File from the resource database on the object. See vtSerialisation for more information. (NOT Impl. yet)
  • Open the vtAgeiaInterface plug-in.
PhysX SDK Parameters:

The PhysX SDK provides many parameters to adjust default values and specific behaviours.

See PhysicManager::setParameter() which parameters can be modified. vtAgeia allows modifications through the Virtools "Variable Manager" too. All parameters can be saved in the cmo.

Open "Variable Manager" in Virtools Dev. There are two new Sections :

  • Physic
  • Physic Debugger
